CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 (length);Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s ex - wife brought an action in trespass against him in ORG , in the context of a dispute concerning the use of the divorced couple ’s flat .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE this court held hearings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court instructed the plaintiff to submit better particulars of her claims .

CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred to the NORP ORG for reasons of competence . On DATE the court held hearings . After a short stay of the proceedings , a further hearing was held on DATE , which the plaintiff did not attend . After another stay , hearings took place on CARDINAL May and DATE . On DATE the plaintiff submitted additional particulars of her claims .

CARDINAL . The court held hearings on DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE . On DATE the court gave judgment , partly finding for the plaintiff . It ordered the applicant to pay compensation to the plaintiff in the amount of MONEY ( ORG ) plus accrued interest . The court held that the subject matter of the case was the settlement of scores concerning the division of the matrimonial property .
CARDINAL . On appeal , on DATE ORG upheld this decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected as inadmissible the applicant ’s petition for review , without examining it on the merits , since the disputed amount fell below the statutory threshold of ORG MONEY , under which no review lay against second - instance decisions .
